column1: Garden Grove is a city in northern Orange County
column3: located 34 miles (55 km) southeast of the city of Los Angeles in the Los Angeles metropolitan area. The population was 170
column4: 883 at the 2010 United States Census. State Route 22
column5: also known as the Garden Grove Freeway
column6: passes through the city in an east-west direction. The western portion of the city is known as West Garden Grove.

column1: Garden Grove was founded by Alonzo Cook in 1874. A school district and Methodist church were organized that year. It remained a small rural crossroads until the arrival of the railroad in 1905. The rail connection helped the town prosper with crops of orange

column2: much of the town's central business district was destroyed by the Long Beach earthquake
column3: and one person was killed at the high school. The post-World War II boom led to rapid development
column4: and Garden Grove was incorporated as a city in 1956 with about 44

column1: An annual event held over Memorial Day weekend
column2: the Garden Grove Strawberry Festival is one of the largest community festivals in the western United States
column4: 000 visitors. It began in 1958 and celebrates the city's agricultural past
column5: which includes cultivating crops such as chili peppers
column7: walnuts and strawberries. Part of the festivities include the cutting of the world's largest strawberry shortcake
column10: and a celebrity-filled parade. Numerous Garden Grove organizations
column11: including the Miss Garden Grove Scholarship Program
column12: are part of the Memorial Day weekend festivities every year. In commemoration of Garden Grove's 50th anniversary
column13: the city painted some of its fire hydrants with a design that featured a strawberry
column14: recognizing the festival as a big part of Garden Grove's history.

column1: Garden Grove uses a council-manager form of government. In July 2015 the city was sued by a resident who claimed that the longstanding at-large elections had affected the Latino vote and was in violation of the California Voting Rights Act. On January 26
column3: the city council voted to settle the lawsuit
column4: and therefore adopted that council members would be voted by district (six districts total) and no longer at-large; the mayor
column6: will continue to be elected at-large. The city council consists of mayor Steve Jones
column9: mayor pro tem John R. O'Neill
column12: and Kim B. Nguyen. According to the city's most recent Comprehensive Annual Financial Report
column13: the city's various funds had $206.0 million in Revenues
column18: and $196.3 million in cash and investments.The following list of city officials is current as of August 2019.

column1: The Garden Grove Police Department provides law enforcement with mutual aid assistance offered at times by the Anaheim Police Department's helicopter
column2: and the Orange County Sheriff's Department Air Unit. In August 2019 the city disbanded its fire department and contracted with The Orange County Fire Authority.

column1: King of Kings Lutheran School is a Christian school (3K-8th grade) of the Wisconsin Evangelical Lutheran Synod (WELS) in Garden Grove.
Garden Grove is home to two stage theaters
column2: the Gem Theater and the Festival Amphitheater. The Festival Amphitheater hosts Shakespeare Orange County
column3: which presents an annual Shakespeare Festival each summer. Both venues are owned by the City of Garden Grove
column4: but operated by outside entities. The Gem Theater is currently operated by Damien Lorton and Nicole Cassesso of 'One More Productions'. The Festival Amphitheater is managed by Thomas Bradac
